item.title: Brain research centre The Florey sues executive, alleging he stole and erased files
item.description: Australia's biggest brain research centre is suing one of its executives, alleging he deleted troves of commercially sensitive information during a midnight incursion at its Melbourne laboratory.

item.description: Fifteen people and one of two gunmen are confirmed to have died after the attack on Sunday evening as members of the Jewish community attended a Hanukkah event in the city's eastern suburbs.

item.description: A Victorian tribunal will investigate whether Mallee Family Care and Mildura Rural City Council could have breached planning permit rules.

item.description: Australia's domestic intelligence agency, ASIO, examined one of the Bondi Beach gunmen six years ago for his close ties to a Sydney-based Islamic State terrorism cell, the ABC understands.

item.description: American rap superstar Kendrick Lamar brought the house down at Spilt Milk in Canberra, but it was his interaction with a nine-year-old superfan that stole the show.

item.title: Sussan Ley accuses Albanese of failing to keep Jewish Australians safe

item.title: WA's wettest towns have had no local drinking water for 15 years

item.description: Anthony Albanese's first responsibility after the horrific Bondi terror attack is to lead a grieving nation. His next will be to explain how this happened.

item.description: Rob Reiner, known for directing When Harry Met Sally... and A Few Good Men, was found dead alongside his wife inside their Los Angeles home.

item.description: An urgent meeting of national cabinet agrees to strengthen Australia's gun laws in the wake of the Bondi Beach shooting.

item.description: A man who caused the death of an elderly couple while driving with methamphetamine in his blood is ordered to complete 100 hours of community service and four months of home detention.

item.description: A NSW inquest has been told exploding lithium-ion batteries caused volatile fires killing three people in separate blazes within minutes.

item.description: The RBA's interest rate-cutting cycle is at an end, and now a hardcore handful of critics say they shouldn't have cut rates in the first place. Conveniently, you only need to look across the ditch to see what could've happened if we'd followed that path.

item.description: A man is in custody following the fatal assault of a man in Cheltenham on Tuesday night.

item.title: Federal politics: Chalmers flags difficult decisions to come in next year's budget — as it happened
item.description: Treasurer Jim Chalmers hands down the Mid-Year Economic and Fiscal Outlook showing an $8.4 billion improvement to the budget bottom line.

item.title: IPL auction sees Cameron Green become the highest-priced overseas player in history
item.description: Cameron Green earns a massive payday on the eve of the Adelaide Test, creating history in the Indian Premier League.

item.title: Rescuers rescue stranded sailors off Lakes Entrance
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Australian sharemarket falls, Westpac removes rate cut call, silver tops $US65 per ounce — as it happened
item.description: Major bank economics teams are rushing to change their cash rate calls ahead of next year. The ASX drops for its third straight day as it follows a mostly negative session on Wall Street, while the price of oil has drops to its lowest level in four years.

item.title: Lung Foundation calls for urgent action on underdiagnosis and undertreatment of COPD
item.description: Experts call for urgent action to turn around an "unacceptable" decline in testing for a disease that kills 20 people every day.

item.title: Doctor who helped supply ketamine to Matthew Perry sentenced to home detention
item.description: A doctor involved in supplying ketamine to Friends actor Matthew Perry before his overdose death is sentenced to eight months of home confinement.

item.title: WA Jewish MP Simon Ehrenfeld feared terror attack before Bondi shooting, says antisemitism 'part of life' in Australia
item.description: State Liberal MP Simon Ehrenfeld says he has felt a greater sense of risk when attending events recently, fearing an increase in antisemitism and the possibility of a terror attack on Australia's Jewish community.

item.title: Nick Reiner to be charged with murder of parents Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner
item.description: Prosecutors will charge the son of film director Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner with two counts of murder.

item.title: FIFA cuts World Cup tickets prices following global backlash
item.description: FIFA backtracks on high-priced World Cup tickets, with a limited amount of seats to be made available for less than $100.

item.title: Hugh Jackman says he is 'heartbroken' for communities affected by Bondi Beach attack
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Crisis teams offer psychological first aid to those affected by Bondi shooting
item.description: In the chaotic hours after the Bondi shooting, bystanders, surf lifesavers and emergency services rushed to the victims to provide first aid.

item.title: WA teenager escapes jail time over petrol station caravan-car theft that left tourist in coma
item.description: A 15-year-old boy who left an elderly tourist in a coma after a Kimberley car theft has escaped immediate jail time.

item.title: Ashes 2025: Alex Carey century carries Australia on day one of third Test against England at Adelaide Oval
item.description: Australia's Alex Carey scores his maiden Ashes century to carry his team to a solid total of 8-326 on day one of the third Test at the Adelaide Oval.

item.title: Rabbi brother of man shot at Bondi urges Jewish Australians not to 'cower'
item.description: The rabbi brother of a healthcare volunteer shot in the Bondi Beach terror attack, damaging his lungs, urges Jewish Australians not to "cower".

item.title: Taskforce Falcon charges alleged 'onshore leader' of Alameddine crime family
item.description: The alleged "onshore leader" of Sydney's fracturing Alameddine crime family has been charged with conspiring to murder two underworld adversaries.

item.title: Tom Silvagni, son of AFL star, sentenced to more than six years' jail for rape
item.description: Tom Silvagni, son of former AFL star Stephen Silvagni, will have to serve at least three years and three months of his sentence.

item.title: Celine Cremer search in Tasmanian bushland uncovers water bottle, garbage bag
item.description: Searchers find a water bottle and a garbage bag that may have been used as a poncho in the Tasmanian bushland where Belgian tourist Celine Cremer went missing.

item.title: High Court overturns ruling that NSW government was not liable for light rail delays
item.description: The move clears the way for businesses to seek compensation from the NSW government after the project hampered traders in the city's CBD for four years.

item.title: Steve Smith ruled out of third Ashes Test in Adelaide due to nausea and dizziness
item.description: Pat Cummins says Steve Smith is a "little bit unwell" as Usman Khawaja makes a shock return to Australia's Test team.

item.title: Donald Trump orders blockade of sanctioned oil tankers leaving and entering Venezuela
item.description: US President Donald Trump's move comes a week after the United States seized a sanctioned oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela.

item.title: Why photos are not the most harmful thing we share about our kids online
item.description: Many parents are aware posting photos of their children online comes with risk. But it's not only images that can be harmful for your child.

item.title: Call for action on homelessness as WA government falls short of target to end rough sleeping
item.description: Social services want the WA government to use its significant budget surplus to invest in breaking people out of the cycle of homelessness, after it failed to achieve its goal of ending rough sleeping.

item.title: Gippsland vegetable farm accused of underpaying migrant workers
item.description: The Fair Work Ombudsman has accused Bulmer Farms in Victoria's East Gippsland region of underpaying migrant workers more than $645,000.

item.title: Man who drove getaway car from fatal Canberra crash will spend at least 21 months in jail
item.description: A getaway driver who helped two teenagers flee the scene of a fatal crash near Parliament House is jailed in the ACT Supreme Court.

item.title: World's tallest spotted gum
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Call for North Brooman nature reserve to protect 70-metre-tall 'Big Spotty'
item.description: Thought to be 500 years old, a 70-metre-tall spotted gum is almost hidden in the middle of a South Coast state forest. Conservationists want the "world champion" tree and the forest it lives in recognised and celebrated.

item.title: Short-term spending rises despite overall budget improvement as Treasury upgrades inflation forecast
item.description: Treasurer Jim Chalmers and Finance Minister Katy Gallagher hand down their first budget update since the 2025 federal election.

item.title: Bondi attack came after huge increase in online antisemitism, early research finds
item.description: Research, which is in the early stages and yet to be peer reviewed, records a significant and worrying increase in antisemitic sentiment since October 7.

item.title: Former treasurer calls for royal commission into Bondi Beach terror attack
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Multi-division world champion Terence Crawford announces retirement from boxing at age 38
item.description: Multi-division, undefeated world champion Terence Crawford has called time on his legendary boxing career and will hang up the gloves at age 38.

item.title: Increased police powers begin at Adelaide Oval Ashes Test following Bondi attacks
item.description: South Australian Police will be carrying rifles and exercising additional weapon and drug search powers at Adelaide Oval during the Third Ashes Test, following the Bondi terror attack on Sunday.

item.title: FBI releases footage of Brown University shooting suspect
item.description: Police say the footage shows the suspect "casing" the area around the campus before the attack.

item.title: CSIRO to receive $233 million in mid-year budget but up to 350 jobs still to be cut
item.description: Just a month after announcing 350 job cuts, the CSIRO has received a funding boost, but proposed job cuts will still happen, the national science agency says.

item.title: Bondi Beach terror attack victim Rabbi Eli Schlanger farewelled at synagogue funeral
item.description: The 'Devoted Rabbi' was the first Bondi terror attack victim farewelled during a heavily guarded funeral at a Bondi synagogue.

item.title: Police officer shot in Bondi Beach terror attack named as Jack Hibbert
item.description: The second police officer injured in Sunday's terrorist attack at Bondi Beach has been identified as 22-year-old Probationary Constable Jack Hibbert.

item.title: Bondi hero Ahmed Al Ahmed a 'source of pride' for family and friends in Syria
item.description: The village of Al Nayrab, in north-west Syria, is the hometown of Bondi hero Ahmed Al Ahmed — and its residents are filled with pride.

item.title: NSW parliament recalled to discuss gun reforms after Bondi Beach shooting
item.description: Premier Chris Minns said among the reforms to be discussed were proposed limits on the number of firearms a licensed shooter could own.

item.title: Falling tree kills farmer tackling blaze in Mindarabin, in WA's Great Southern
item.description: A 34-year-old farmer dies helping fight a fire in Mindarabin, in WA's Great Southern region.

item.title: Former Beauty and the Geek contestant's murder case adjourned as SA court awaits more evidence
item.description: Police are still waiting to examine a large volume of evidence, including a a post-mortem report in the "complex" alleged murder case involving Tamika Chesser, a court has heard.

item.title: Arsonist sentenced for 2023 fire that killed housemate in north-west Victorian town of Red Cliffs
item.description: A man who pleaded guilty to arson after lighting a fire that killed his housemate has been jailed for 11 years. A Supreme Court justice said his actions were "extremely dangerous" and unsophisticated.

item.title: Shakira Adams gets maximum time behind bars for crash that killed Matthew McLuckie
item.description: Shakira Adams had no licence and methamphetamine in her system when she drove a stolen car at least 177 kilometres per hour into Matthew McLuckie's car.

item.title: Rays and sharks washed up on Kangaroo Island linked to algal bloom
item.description: Dead rays and sharks found along a regional South Australia beach have been linked to the algal bloom, the government confirms.

item.title: Former AFL footballer Marlion Pickett handed suspended prison term
item.description: Dual Richmond premiership player Marlion Pickett receives a suspended prison term for possessing and dealing with proceeds of crime, in what a judge calls a "line-ball decision".

item.title: Tasmania Police charge man and woman over alleged carjacking and firearm incident
item.description: Police arrested the pair on Tuesday, following investigations into an alleged carjacking and firearm incident on Hobart's eastern shore in October.

item.title: Police lay murder charge against 47-year-old man, three years after woman's death in Katherine
item.description: Police have charged a 47-year-old man with murder three years after the death of a woman who was found unconscious on a street corner in Katherine.

item.title: Frydenberg calls for antisemitism royal commission after Bondi attack
item.description: Former treasurer Josh Frydenberg has called for bans on radical "hate preachers," protests, stronger immigration laws and a royal commission into antisemitism in an emotional speech at the site of the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: Bondi shooter Naveed Akram charged by NSW Police over terrorist attack
item.description: Naveed Akram has been charged over the terrorist attack that killed 15 people at Bondi Beach.

item.title: North Queensland's small Jewish community celebrates Hanukkah in Townsville
item.description: North Queensland's only rabbi did not let a nine-hour traffic delay stop him from spreading light during Hanukkah to a Jewish community grappling with the Bondi tragedy.

item.title: High school graduate Annabelle Klint-Pedersen weeks away from moving overseas before fatal fall
item.description: Annabelle Klint-Pedersen was celebrating the end of year 12 with friends on the Sunshine Coast when an innocent trip to watch the sunset went tragically wrong.

item.title: Australians are rushed and time-poor with most working unpaid hours
item.description: Most people spent time doing unpaid work in 2024, according to new data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics. It found women spent on average an hour more doing unpaid work than men.

item.title: Queensland records worst flu season in a decade, with cases 18 per cent up on last year
item.description: Official data shows more than 90,000 lab-confirmed cases of influenza in 2025, which is more than an 18 per cent jump on the number of cases reported last year.

item.title: Tom McLuckie outside court after Shakira Adams is sentenced over his son Matthew's death
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Noosa Council blames 'human error' for $2.3 million AI scam
item.description: The Noosa Council is now blaming human error for a major fraud incident that cost ratepayers millions of dollars — while not acknowledging earlier supplier scam warnings.

item.title: Loved ones seek support to repatriate minivan crash victims to Papua New Guinea
item.description: A teenage boy and a 51-year-old woman from Papua New Guinea have been identified as victims of a fatal crash in Northern Victoria.

item.title: Day-night Tests locked in for Australian summer until 2031
item.description: Cricket Australia CEO Todd Greenberg opens up on the future of day-night Tests in the future summer schedule.

item.title: Talison Lithium will not reopen historic rail line from world's biggest lithium mine after finding it economically unviable
item.description: Talison Lithium rules out reopening a century-old rail line from the world's biggest lithium mine, despite ongoing complaints about truck traffic and dust.

item.title: Ashes drama for Steve Smith, Alex Carey and DRS — quick hits from day one of the fourth Test at Adelaide Oval
item.description: Australia's first-innings topscorers get some help from England's sloppy fielders and the DRS technology on a tightly contested day in Adelaide. Here are the quick hits from day one of the third Ashes Test.

item.title: Teenager jailed after stabbing doctor at Tasmanian hospital in 2023
item.description: A doctor went through a "lengthy, risky and complicated" surgery and continues to experience nightmares and flashbacks after being stabbed by a teenager he was treating in 2023, a court is told.

item.title: Live updates: Tim Tszyu vs Anthony Velazquez, super welterweight boxing clash in Sydney
item.description: Tim Tszyu faces a make-or-break test against unbeaten American Anthony Velazquez at the Sydney Entertainment Centre. Follow live.

item.title: Alex Carey's maiden Ashes ton rescues Australia, delights Adelaide and elevates his status
item.description: Alex Carey looked to the heavens as his name rang out from the Adelaide Oval stands, his emotional century saving Australia's day one and furthering his push to one day stand among the great wicketkeeper-bats.

item.title: Cyril Mark Yeeda faces court over alleged $170k sale of alcohol in WA dry communities
item.description: Police allege Cyril Mark Yeeda sold $45,000 worth of alcohol in dry communities for $170,000.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: NSW man refused bail charged with depicting Adolf Hitler and Nazi symbols on boat
item.description: Lake Macquarie man Jake Dearie has been refused bail after being charged with depicting Adolf Hitler and Nazi symbols on his boat.

item.title: ACT inquiry slams 'aggressive' debt recovery in stamp duty concession scheme
item.description: A legislative inquiry has criticised the ACT government for aggressively recovering debts from people it found were ineligible for stamp duty concessions.
